result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • John M. Castner was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and court costs are to be paid as follows:  $100 due on or before 7-1-16 and then $100 due by the 1st of each month therafter until paid in full.  15CT81 and 16CM42 are combined into this payment plan.  There is also a $15 payment plan fee added to the payment plan.  Failure to pay any part of the fine will result in serving 30 days jail.
Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Sentenced to 95 days jail to commence immediately.  1 day jail credit granted.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.
Must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  You must also comply with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M. Castner

defendant.name: Castner, John M.
defendant.address: 218 Park Ave, Blk River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Petition for IID Exemption received from defendant.  Forward to Judge for review.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears with counsel Charles Betthauser.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA Fox states he has authorization to dispose of the 15TR2523; defendant will plea to Count 1 in 15CT81 and the State filed an amended complaint in 16CM42, which the defendant will plead to Count 4.  Court reviews the charge and penalties in 15CT81.  Defendant understands and enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Court reviews the elements; defendant admits to prior conviction.  16CM42 - Defendant waives reading of amended complaint and enters a plea of no contest to the amended Count 4.  Court performs plea questionnaire colloquy on both cases/reviews charge & penalties/waiver of rights with defendant.  Defendant states reason he is rejecting probation.  Judge accepts his decision.  Defense stipulates to factual basis found in the complaints.  Court finds his pleas and wavier of rights are made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Court accepts his pleas and finds him guilty and adopts the recommendations.  Orders sentence on 15CT81:  $350 fine plus costs; 10 days jail to be served consecutive to 16CM42; license is revoked 12 months and IID ordered for 12 months; alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  No jail credit on 15CT81.  Sentence ordered on 16CM42:  $1200 fine plus costs; 95 days jail to commence immediately; license is revoked for 27 months and IID 27 months; alcohol assessment and driver safety plan.  Granted 1 day jail credit on 16CM42.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge on both cases.  Counts 1, 2, 3 are DRI; Counts 4 & 6 are dismissed outright.  All civil TR's are DRI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Have an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing with JA.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Report for booking.

Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Report for booking.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser, specially.  Reading of the complaint waived.  NGP entered. PTC set for 4/6 and STC 4/18 at 3 pm.  NGP on citations also.
